flow-definition.description:
Job that is able to fetch and build the code of any project to then retrieve its built artifacts. Those built artifacts are then deployed on the configured artifact repository (typically Nexus.)
It takes as an input a bunch of 'commit metadata', i.e. all the information about a specific code commit that is triggering the current build.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: projectType
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
The type of the code project
Supported values: 'openmrsmodule', 'bahmniapps', 'bahmnicore', 'bahmniconfig', 'openmrsconfig', 'openmrscore', 'distribution'

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: repoUrl
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
The code project's repository URL
Eg. "https://github.com/openmrs/openmrs-core"

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: branchName
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The branch that should be built.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: commitId
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
The commit that should be built.
Certain projects require to pinpoint to an exact commit rather than using the tip of a branch.

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: artifactsDeployment
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Tells whether built artifacts should be deployed to their repository.
